verses.verse: A good name <WH8034> is better <WH2896> than precious <WH2896> ointment <WH8081>; and the day <WH3117> of death <WH4194> than the day <WH3117> of one's birth <WH3205> <WH8736>.

It is better <WH2896> to go <WH3212> <WH8800> to the house <WH1004> of mourning <WH60>, than to go <WH3212> <WH8800> to the house <WH1004> of feasting <WH4960>: for <WH834> that is the end <WH5490> of all men <WH120>; and the living <WH2416> will lay <WH5414> <WH8799> it to his heart <WH3820>.
Sorrow <WH3708> is better <WH2896> than laughter <WH7814>: for by the sadness <WH7455> of the countenance <WH6440> the heart <WH3820> is made better <WH3190> <WH8799>.
The heart <WH3820> of the wise <WH2450> is in the house <WH1004> of mourning <WH60>; but the heart <WH3820> of fools <WH3684> is in the house <WH1004> of mirth <WH8057>.
It is better <WH2896> to hear <WH8085> <WH8800> the rebuke <WH1606> of the wise <WH2450>, than for a man <WH376> to hear <WH8085> <WH8802> the song <WH7892> of fools <WH3684>.
For as the crackling <WH6963> of tshofars <WH5518> under a pot <WH5518>, so is the laughter <WH7814> of the fool <WH3684>: this also is vanity <WH1892>.
Surely oppression <WH6233> maketh a wise man <WH2450> mad <WH1984> <WH8779>; and a gift <WH4979> destroyeth <WH6> <WH8762> the heart <WH3820>.
Better <WH2896> is the end <WH319> of a thing <WH1697> than the beginning <WH7225> thereof: and the patient <WH750> in spirit <WH7307> is better <WH2896> than the proud <WH1362> in spirit <WH7307>.
Be not hasty <WH926> <WH8762> in thy spirit <WH7307> to be angry <WH3707> <WH8800>: for anger <WH3708> resteth <WH5117> <WH8799> in the bosom <WH2436> of fools <WH3684>.
Say <WH559> <WH8799> not thou, What is the cause that the former <WH7223> days <WH3117> were better <WH2896> than these? for thou dost not enquire <WH7592> <WH8804> wisely <WH2451> concerning this.
Wisdom <WH2451> is good <WH2896> with an inheritance <WH5159>: and by it there is profit <WH3148> to them that see <WH7200> <WH8802> the sun <WH8121>.

For wisdom <WH2451> is a defence <WH6738>, and money <WH3701> is a defence <WH6738>: but the excellency <WH3504> of knowledge <WH1847> is, that wisdom <WH2451> giveth life <WH2421> <WH8762> to them that have <WH1167> it.
Consider <WH7200> <WH8798> the work <WH4639> of 'Elohim <WH430>: for who can <WH3201> <WH8799> make that straight <WH8626> <WH8763>, which he hath made crooked <WH5791> <WH8765> ?

In the day <WH3117> of prosperity <WH2896> be joyful <WH2896>, but in the day <WH3117> of adversity <WH7451> consider <WH7200> <WH8798>: 'Elohim <WH430> also hath set <WH6213> <WH8804> the one over against <WH5980> the other, to the end <WH1700> that man <WH120> should find <WH4672> <WH8799> nothing <WH3972> after <WH310> him.

All things have I seen <WH7200> <WH8804> in the days <WH3117> of my vanity <WH1892>: there is <WH3426> a just <WH6662> man that perisheth <WH6> <WH8802> in his righteousness <WH6664>, and there is a wicked <WH7563> man that prolongeth <WH748> <WH8688> his life in his wickedness <WH7451>.
Be not righteous <WH6662> over much <WH7235> <WH8687>; neither make thyself over <WH3148> wise <WH2449> <WH8691>: why shouldest thou destroy <WH8074> <WH8709> thyself?
Be not over much <WH7235> <WH8687> wicked <WH7561> <WH8799>, neither be thou foolish <WH5530>: why shouldest thou die <WH4191> <WH8799> before thy time <WH6256> ?

It is good <WH2896> that thou shouldest take hold <WH270> <WH8799> of this; yea, also from this <WH2088> withdraw <WH3240> <WH8686> not thine hand <WH3027>: for he that feareth <WH3373> 'Elohim <WH430> shall come forth <WH3318> <WH8799> of them all.
Wisdom <WH2451> strengtheneth <WH5810> <WH8799> the wise <WH2450> more than ten <WH6235> mighty <WH7989> men which are in the city <WH5892>.
For there is not a just <WH6662> man <WH120> upon earth <WH776>, that doeth <WH6213> <WH8799> good <WH2896>, and sinneth <WH2398> <WH8799> not.
Also take <WH5414> <WH8799> no heed <WH3820> unto all words <WH1697> that are spoken <WH1696> <WH8762>; lest thou hear <WH8085> <WH8799> thy servant <WH5650> curse <WH7043> <WH8764> thee:
For oftentimes <WH6471> <WH7227> also thine own heart <WH3820> knoweth <WH3045> <WH8804> that thou thyself likewise hast cursed <WH7043> <WH8765> others <WH312>.
All this <WH2090> have I proved <WH5254> <WH8765> by wisdom <WH2451>: I said <WH559> <WH8804>, I will be wise <WH2449> <WH8799>; but it was far <WH7350> from me.
That which is far off <WH7350>, and exceeding deep <WH6013>, who can find it out <WH4672> <WH8799> ?

I applied <WH5437> <WH8804> mine heart <WH3820> to know <WH3045> <WH8800>, and to search <WH8446> <WH8800>, and to seek out <WH1245> <WH8763> wisdom <WH2451>, and the reason <WH2808> of things, and to know <WH3045> <WH8800> the wickedness <WH7562> of folly <WH3689>, even of foolishness <WH5531> and madness <WH1947>:

And I find <WH4672> <WH8802> more bitter <WH4751> than death <WH4194> the woman <WH802>, whose heart <WH3820> is snares <WH4685> and nets <WH2764>, and her hands <WH3027> as bands <WH612>: whoso pleaseht <WH2896> <WH6440> 'Elohim <WH430> shall escape <WH4422> <WH8735> from her; but the sinner <WH2398> <WH8802> shall be taken <WH3920> <WH8735> by her.
Behold <WH7200> <WH8798>, this have I found <WH4672> <WH8804>, saith <WH559> <WH8804> the preacher <WH6953>, counting one <WH259> by one <WH259>, to find out <WH4672> <WH8800> the account <WH2808>:

Which yet my soul <WH5315> seeketh <WH1245> <WH8765>, but I find <WH4672> <WH8804> not: one <WH259> man <WH120> among a thousand <WH505> have I found <WH4672> <WH8804>; but a woman <WH802> among all those have I not found <WH4672> <WH8804>.

Lo <WH7200> <WH8798>, this only <WH905> have I found <WH4672> <WH8804>, that 'Elohim <WH430> hath made <WH6213> <WH8804> man <WH120> upright <WH3477>; but they have sought out <WH1245> <WH8765> many <WH7227> inventions <WH2810>.
